author: potuz
content: My idea above to artificially delay finalization doesn't work. Casper is robust, it doesn't matter if one doesn't call it finalized, nothing will revert from a justified epoch whose child is justified.

author: potuz
content: I thought at first that this would be very hard to implement, but I think now that it may not be that bad. We may even have an artificial list of invalid indices that are added to the current shuffling algo and grow that list over time

author: jgm
content: Not going to argue this point, but I'm against continuing the ice age after the merge.  If there is a failure to reach reasonable social consensus on a specific upgrade, or upgrades in general, there may be a good reason for it.  Creating a forcing function removes the ability to ask the question "do we need to upgrade?", which to me appears to be a reduction in freedom.
